About the Board of Library Trustees The Board of Library Trustees comprises volunteers who serve as the policy and planning body for the Jacksonville Public Library system. There are 12 voting members and at least two non-voting members who serve in an ex officio capacity. Non-voting members are the city council president or a designee and up to one additional council member, and the superintendent of schools or a designee. Trustees are appointed by the mayor and confirmed by the city council. Each trustee serves a four-year term and may serve a total of two consecutive terms.

About the Board of Library Trustees The Board of Library Trustees comprises volunteers who serve as the policy and planning body for the Jacksonville Public Library system. There are 12 voting members and at least two non-voting members who serve in an ex officio capacity. Non-voting members are the city council president or a designee and up to one additional council member, and the superintendent of schools or a designee. Trustees are appointed by the mayor and confirmed by the city council. Each trustee serves a four-year term and may serve a total of two consecutive terms.

Jacksonville Public Library is a large library system, consisting of a 300,000 sq. ft. Main Library and twenty regional, community and neighborhood branch libraries. We also serve the needs of the community with a Special Needs Library for disabled customers and an active adult literacy and lifelong learning program.

Effective: September 27, 2022  Last Reviewed: January 21, 2022  Purpose  The purpose of this policy is to define, establish and communicate the criteria and guiding principles related to the  presentation of public programming by and on behalf of the Jacksonville Public Library (the “Library”) in support of the  organization's mission and strategic plans.

Frequently Asked Questions
Please read for information regarding most inquiries.
How can I pay a bill on my account?
The library accepts bill payment on the self check machines located in the library. The library accepts credit card, Apple Pay, Google Pay, and cash payments ($1, $5, and $10 bills accepted).
How do I conduct business with Jacksonville Public Library?
As a department of the City of Jacksonville (COJ), all vendors or suppliers making inquiries into conducting business with the Jacksonville Public Library should be directed to the
COJ Procurement Division
.
How can I get help with materials returned displaying as checked-out, overdue, or in collections?
Get help from Library experts with materials returned displaying as checked-out, overdue, or in collections by submitting this
form
.
How can I get help with streaming media, e-books, e-audio books, databases, etc.?
Please use the
Help with streaming media, e-books, e-audio books, databases, etc.
form to get expert Library help with these services
You can also find helpful solutions at
Libby Help
,
Hoopla Help
, or
Kanopy Help
.
How do I suggest a book for the library to purchase?
Please use this
form
to suggest a title to be added to the Jacksonville Public Library collection.
How do I market my book at the library?
Please read the information provided in
Marketing Your Book to the Jacksonville Public Library
to find out.
How do I add a book I wrote to the Local Author Collection?
To have your book considered for adding to the Local Author Collection, click here
Submit to the Local Author Collection
.
How can I suggest a program or event for the Jacksonville Public Library to consider?
To suggest a program or event to the Library for consideration please review the specifications for how the Library goes about creating and delivering a program and submit your idea via this
form
.
How do I report a lost or stolen library card?
Please use the
Report a Lost or Stolen Library Card
form.
I have books to donate. Where and when can I drop them off?
Books and DVDs in good condition may be brought to any Library location. The materials you donate primarily help the Friends of the Library raise money for the Library through book sales.
To understand more on what and how the Library accepts donations and how you can donate books and other materials to the Library please review Library
policies
. Call 904-255-BOOK (2665) for more information.
How do I volunteer at the Library?
Apply to
volunteer at the Library
.
How can I ask a question not covered here or start a conversation with the Library?
Please use the
Ask A Librarian
service for help with your question not answered in the FAQ or covered in the list below.
How do I contact library leadership?
Please use the form on the Board of Trustees
page
to send a question or comment to the Library Director or the Board of Library Trustees (BOLT).
